model_input:
[Task Description]
You will be given DIALOGUE CONTEXT and MEMORY.
Your job is to judge if MEMORY contains helpful past information for a language model, representing Unknown, to generate a proper next response based on DIALOGUE CONTEXT.

If the DIALOUGE CONTEXT does not require the model to utilize past information for response generation, say "N/A".
Say "Yes" if MEMORY contains such helpful information and say "No" if it dose not.
Provide a brief explanation for your judgement.

[Format Regulation]
Generate your output below OUTPUT using the following format:
Brief explanation: your explanation
Judgement: "Yes", "No", or "N/A"

[Task]
DIALOGUE CONTEXT:
Co-workers A: I really enjoy public speaking. It's such a great way to connect with people and convey a message.

[MEMORY]
User Description:
Co-workers A is a confident individual who stands up for what they believe in and is not afraid to defend themselves when attacked. They are known for their strong figures and facts, as well as their ability to present evidence clearly and concisely in court. Co-workers A can sometimes get physical when defending themselves, but they also have the courage to speak in front of a judge when necessary. Despite having a reputation of looking for a fight, Co-workers A is appreciative of support and is confident that their hard work will pay off in the end.

Relationship Description:
Co-workers B hopes for Co-workers A's success in their case and wishes them good luck. Co-workers B also believes that Co-workers A needs to learn to control their emotions and handle conflicts more maturely. Despite this, Co-workers B praises Co-workers A's courage in presenting evidence in front of a judge.

Event Description:
Karen gave money to Co-workers A for car repairs, showcasing a moment of trust. Co-workers A also built Co-workers B's house and recommended a landscaping company, highlighting their helpful and supportive nature towards their co-workers.
